verses.text: 彼得向耶路撒冷教會報告使徒和在猶太的弟兄們，聽說外族人也接受了 神的道。

words.note: Refers to fellow believers in a religious context.
Specifically refers to non-Jews in biblical context.
Refers to God's message or truth (logos).

verses.text: 彼得上到耶路撒冷的時候，那些守割禮的人與他爭論，

words.note: Refers to Jewish believers who insisted on circumcision.

verses.text: 說：「你竟然到未受割禮的人那裡，跟他們一起吃飯！」
彼得就按著次序向他們講解，說：
「我在約帕城禱告的時候，魂遊象外，見到異象：有一件東西，好像一塊大布，綁著四角，從天上降下來，一直來到我面前。

words.note: Lit. 'soul wandering outside form', describing a spiritual trance.
Etymologically 'east-west', referring to goods bought from all directions.

verses.text: 我定睛觀察，看見裡面有地上的四足牲畜、走獸，還有昆蟲和天空的飛鳥。

words.note: Refers to fixing one's gaze.
Refers to domesticated animals, often for food or labor.
Refers to animals that walk or run on land.

verses.text: 我也聽見有聲音對我說：『彼得，起來，宰了吃！』
我說：『主啊，千萬不可，因為俗物或不潔的東西，從來沒有進過我的口。』

words.note: A respectful address for God or a revered person.
Often used with negation: 'never under any circumstances'.
Refers to things not consecrated or considered holy.
A common compound for 'thing', literal meaning 'east-west' has lost its original significance.
Always used with negation to mean 'never'.

verses.text: 第二次又有聲音從天上回答：『 神所潔淨的，你不可當作俗物。』

words.note: The space often indicates reverence in Chinese Bible translations.
Indicates the object of the verb that follows, similar to a passive construction.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, 'that which is cleansed'.
Refers to things not consecrated or considered holy.

verses.text: 這樣一連三次之後，所有的東西都拉回天上去了。

words.note: A common compound for 'thing', literal meaning 'east-west' has lost its original significance.
Indicates movement away from the speaker.

verses.text: 就在那個時候，有三個從該撒利亞派到我這裡來的人，站在我住的房子門前。

words.note: Indicates immediacy or consequence.
General measure word.

verses.text: 聖靈吩咐我跟他們一起去，一點也不要疑惑。這六位弟兄也跟我一起去，我們就進了那人的家。

words.note: Specifically refers to the Holy Spirit in Christian theology.
Often used for instructions given by a superior.
Often used with '也' and '不' to mean 'not at all'.
Polite measure word for people.
In biblical context, often refers to fellow believers.
Indicates a sequence or consequence.

verses.text: 他告訴我們，他怎樣看見天使站在他家裡說：『派人到約帕去，請那個名叫彼得的西門來，

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 他有話要告訴你，使你和你全家都可以得救。』

words.note: Refers to spiritual salvation in this context.

verses.text: 我一開始講話，聖靈就降在他們身上，正像當初降在我們身上一樣。

words.note: Used with '就' to mean 'as soon as... then...'
Often pairs with '一 (yī)' for 'as soon as... then...'
Can imply a downward movement or bestowal.
Emphasizes exactness, often with '像'.

verses.text: 我就想起主所說的話：『約翰用水施洗，但你們要受聖靈的洗。』

words.note: Indicates the following verb is acted upon or relates to a previous noun.
Here acting as a noun for 'baptism'.

verses.text: 神既然把同樣的恩賜（「恩賜」或譯「恩賞」）給他們，像給我們這些信了主耶穌基督的人一樣，我是誰，我能夠阻止 神嗎？」

words.note: Marks the object of a verb before the verb.
Indicates reverence for God's name.

verses.text: 眾人聽見這些話，就默然無聲，把榮耀歸給 神，說：「這樣看來， 神也把悔改的心賜給外族人，使他們得生命。」

words.note: An idiom meaning 'in silent stillness'.

verses.text: 安提阿的教會那些因司提反事件遭受苦難而四散的門徒，一直走到腓尼基、塞浦路斯、安提阿；他們不對別人傳講，只對猶太人傳講。
但其中有些塞浦路斯人和古利奈人，來到安提阿，也對希臘人傳講主耶穌。
主的手與他們同在，信而歸主的人就多起來。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical context for God's presence.
Connects clauses, indicating a sequential or causal relationship.
A specific biblical phrase for conversion.
Here, it turns '信而歸主' into a modifier for '人'.
The suffix '起來' indicates the beginning or upward trend of an action.

verses.text: 這事傳到耶路撒冷教會的耳中，他們就派巴拿巴到安提阿去。

words.note: Refers to a religious congregation or institution.
Often used as a suffix to indicate 'inside' or 'among'.

verses.text: 他到了那裡，看見 神所施的恩，就很歡喜，勸勉眾人堅心靠主。

words.note: A resultative verb compound, 'to look and succeed in seeing'.
The leading space indicates reverence for God.
Used to form a nominalized phrase, similar to 'that which is done by'.
Often used in spiritual contexts for unwavering faith.

verses.text: 巴拿巴是個好人，滿有聖靈和信心，於是許多人歸了主。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical contexts to describe being filled with qualities or the Spirit.
Combines 'turn to the Lord' with the perfective particle '了'.

verses.text: 後來他到大數去找掃羅，

words.note: Here indicates purpose: 'go in order to'.

verses.text: 找到了，就帶他來安提阿。足足有一年，他們一同在教會聚集，教導了許多人。門徒稱為基督徒，是從安提阿開始的。

words.note: Repetition emphasizes completeness or sufficiency.
Lit. 'Christ follower'

verses.text: 那時，有幾位先知從耶路撒冷下到安提阿。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'

verses.text: 其中有一個名叫亞迦布的站起來，藉著聖靈指出天下將要有大饑荒；這事在革老丟時期果然發生了。

words.note: Refers to the whole world, traditionally meaning 'all under Heaven'.

verses.text: 於是門徒決定按著各人的力量捐款，好送給住在猶太的弟兄。

words.note: Used as a conjunction meaning 'so that', indicating purpose.
A common biblical term for fellow believers or brethren.

verses.text: 他們就這樣行了，由巴拿巴和掃羅經手送到長老們那裡。

words.note: Lit. 'pass through hands', implying direct handling.
Functions as a location or general direction, 'to where they were'.
